meanings.definition: To expose (film or a photograph) to light insufficiently during processing, reducing the brightness of the image.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally underexposed the photo, so it turned out too dark.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often underexpose images to create a moody atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The film director joked that he would underexpose the scene to make the actors look mysterious.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like underexposed photographs, dim and unclear.
meanings.sent5: The artist deliberately underexposed the painting to convey a sense of mystery and intrigue.
